text: In six days work may be done, but on the seventh day there must be a holy day for you, a Sabbath of complete rest to the Lord. Anyone who does work on it will be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must not kindle a fire in any of your homes on the Sabbath day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses spoke to the whole community of the Israelites, “This is the word that the Lord has commanded:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Take an offering for the Lord. Let everyone who has a willing heart bring an offering to the Lord: gold, silver, bronze;
speaker: Narrator

text: blue, purple, and scarlet yarn; fine linen; goats’ hair;
speaker: Narrator

text: ram skins dyed red; fine leather; acacia wood;
speaker: Narrator

text: olive oil for the light; spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense;
speaker: Narrator

text: onyx stones, and other gems for mounting on the ephod and the breastpiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every skilled person among you is to come and make all that the Lord has commanded:
speaker: Narrator

text: the tabernacle with its tent, its covering, its clasps, its frames, its crossbars, its posts, and its bases;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ark, with its poles, the atonement lid, and the special curtain that conceals it;
speaker: Narrator

text: the table with its poles and all its vessels, and the Bread of the Presence;
speaker: Narrator

text: the lampstand for the light and its accessories, its lamps, and oil for the light;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the altar of incense with its poles, the anointing oil, and the fragrant incense; the hanging for the door at the entrance of the tabernacle;
speaker: Narrator

text: the altar for the burnt offering with its bronze grating that is on it, its poles, and all its utensils; the large basin and its pedestal;
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the courtyard, its posts and its bases, and the curtain for the gateway to the courtyard;
speaker: Narrator

text: tent pegs for the tabernacle and tent pegs for the courtyard and their ropes;
speaker: Narrator

text: the woven garments for serving in the Holy Place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments for his sons to minister as priests.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the whole community of the Israelites went out from the presence of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone whose heart stirred him to action and everyone whose spirit was willing came and brought the offering for the Lord for the work of the tent of meeting, for all its service, and for the holy garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came, men and women alike, all who had willing hearts. They brought brooches, earrings, rings and ornaments, all kinds of gold jewelry, and everyone came who waved a wave offering of gold to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who had blue, purple, or scarlet yarn, fine linen, goats’ hair, ram skins dyed red, or fine leather brought them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone making an offering of silver or bronze brought it as an offering to the Lord, and everyone who had acacia wood for any work of the service brought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every woman who was skilled spun with her hands and brought what she had spun, blue, purple, or scarlet yarn, or fine linen,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the women whose heart stirred them to action and who were skilled spun goats’ hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: The leaders brought onyx stones and other gems to be mounted for the ephod and the breastpiece,
speaker: Narrator

text: and spices and olive oil for the light, for the anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites brought a freewill offering to the Lord, every man and woman whose heart was willing to bring materials for all the work that the Lord through Moses had commanded them to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the Israelites, “See, the Lord has chosen Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has filled him with the Spirit of God—with skill, with understanding, with knowledge, and in all kinds of work—
speaker: Narrator

text: to design artistic designs, to work in gold, in silver, and in bronze,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in cutting stones for their setting, and in cutting wood, to do work in every artistic craft.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has put it in his heart to teach, he and Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has filled them with skill to do all kinds of work as craftsmen, as designers, as embroiderers in blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and in fine linen, and as weavers. They are craftsmen in all the work and artistic designers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Bezalel and Oholiab and every skilled person in whom the Lord has put skill and ability to know how to do all the work for the service of the sanctuary are to do the work according to all that the Lord has commanded.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses summoned Bezalel and Oholiab and every skilled person in whom the Lord had put skill—everyone whose heart stirred him to volunteer to do the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: They received from Moses all the offerings the Israelites had brought to do the work for the service of the sanctuary, and they still continued to bring him a freewill offering each morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the skilled people who were doing all the work on the sanctuary came from the work they were doing
speaker: Narrator

text: and told Moses, “The people are bringing much more than is needed for the completion of the work which the Lord commanded us to do!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses instructed them to take his message throughout the camp, saying, “Let no man or woman do anymore work for the offering for the sanctuary.” So the people were restrained from bringing any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the materials were more than enough for them to do all the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the skilled among those who were doing the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twisted linen and blue and purple and scarlet yarn; they were made with cherubim that were the work of an artistic designer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of one curtain was 42 feet, and the width of one curtain was 6 feet—the same size for each of the curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: He joined five of the curtains to one another, and the other five curtains he joined to one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made loops of blue material along the edge of the end curtain in the first set; he did the same along the edge of the end curtain in the second set.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made fifty loops on the first curtain, and he made fifty loops on the end curtain that was in the second set, with the loops opposite one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made fifty gold clasps and joined the curtains together to one another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle was a unit.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made curtains of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; he made eleven curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of one curtain was 45 feet, and the width of one curtain was 6 feet—one size for all eleven curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: He joined five curtains by themselves and six curtains by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made fifty loops along the edge of the end curtain in the first set and fifty loops along the edge of the curtain that joined the second set.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made fifty bronze clasps to join the tent together so that it might be a unit.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a covering for the tent out of ram skins dyed red and over that a covering of fine leather.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the frames for the tabernacle of acacia wood as uprights.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of each frame was 15 feet, the width of each frame was 2¼ feet,
speaker: Narrator

text: with two projections per frame parallel one to another. He made all the frames of the tabernacle in this way.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he made frames for the tabernacle: twenty frames for the south side.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made forty silver bases under the twenty frames—two bases under the first frame for its two projections, and likewise two bases under the next frame for its two projections,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the second side of the tabernacle, the north side, he made twenty frames
speaker: Narrator

text: and their forty silver bases, two bases under the first frame and two bases under the next frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the back of the tabernacle on the west he made six frames.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made two frames for the corners of the tabernacle on the back.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the two corners they were doubled at the lower end and finished together at the top in one ring. So he did for both.
speaker: Narrator

text: So there were eight frames and their silver bases, sixteen bases, two bases under each frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made bars of acacia wood, five for the frames on one side of the tabernacle
speaker: Narrator

text: and five bars for the frames on the second side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the frames of the tabernacle for the back side on the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the middle bar to reach from end to end in the center of the frames.
speaker: Narrator

text: He overlaid the frames with gold and made their rings of gold to provide places for the bars, and he overlaid the bars with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the special curtain of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine twisted linen; he made it with cherubim, the work of an artistic designer.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made for it four posts of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold, with gold hooks, and he cast for them four silver bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a hanging for the entrance of the tent of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine twisted linen, the work of an embroiderer,
speaker: Narrator

text: and its five posts and their hooks. He overlaid their tops and their bands with gold, but their five bases were bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood; its length was 45 inches, its width 27 inches, and its height 27 inches.
speaker: Narrator

text: He overlaid it with pure gold, inside and out, and he made a surrounding border of gold for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast four gold rings for it that he put on its four feet, with two rings on one side and two rings on the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made poles of acacia wood, overlaid them with gold,
speaker: Narrator

text: and put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark in order to carry the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made an atonement lid of pure gold; its length was 45 inches, and its width was 27 inches.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made two cherubim of gold; he made them of hammered metal on the two ends of the atonement lid,
speaker: Narrator

text: one cherub on one end and one cherub on the other end. He made the cherubim from the atonement lid on its two ends.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cherubim were spreading their wings upward, overshadowing the atonement lid with their wings. The cherubim faced each other, looking toward the atonement lid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel made the table of acacia wood; its length was 36 inches, its width 18 inches, and its height 27 inches.
speaker: Narrator

text: He overlaid it with pure gold, and he made a surrounding border of gold for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a surrounding frame for it about three inches wide, and he made a surrounding border of gold for its frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast four gold rings for it and attached the rings at the four corners where its four legs were.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rings were close to the frame to provide places for the poles to carry the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold, to carry the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the vessels which were on the table out of pure gold, its plates, its ladles, its pitchers, and its bowls, to be used in pouring out offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel made the lampstand of pure gold. He made the lampstand of hammered metal; its base and its shaft, its cups, its buds, and its blossoms were from the same piece.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six branches were extending from its sides, three branches of the lampstand from one side of it, and three branches of the lampstand from the other side of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms were on the first branch, and three cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms were on the next branch, and the same for the six branches that were extending from the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the lampstand there were four cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms,
speaker: Narrator

text: with a bud under the first two branches from it, and a bud under the next two branches from it, and a bud under the third two branches from it; according to the six branches that extended from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their buds and their branches were of one piece; all of it was one hammered piece of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made its seven lamps, its trimmers, and its trays of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the lampstand and all its accessories with seventy-five pounds of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel made the incense altar of acacia wood. Its length was 18 inches and its width 18 inches—a square—and its height was 36 inches. Its horns were of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He overlaid it with pure gold—its top, its four walls, and its horns—and he made a surrounding border of gold for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made two gold rings for it under its border, on its two sides, on opposite sides, as places for poles to carry it with.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the sacred anointing oil and the pure fragrant incense, the work of a perfumer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel made the altar for the burnt offering of acacia wood 7½ feet long and 7½ feet wide—it was square—and its height was 4½ feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made its horns on its four corners; its horns were part of it, and he overlaid it with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made all the utensils of the altar—the pots, the shovels, the tossing bowls, the meat hooks, and the fire pans—he made all its utensils of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a grating for the altar, a network of bronze under its ledge, halfway up from the bottom.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast four rings for the four corners of the bronze grating, to provide places for the poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, with which to carry it. He made the altar hollow, out of boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the large basin of bronze and its pedestal of bronze from the mirrors of the women who served at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel made the courtyard. For the south side the hangings of the courtyard were of fine twisted linen, 150 feet long,
speaker: Narrator

text: with their twenty posts and their twenty bronze bases, with the hooks of the posts and their bands of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the north side the hangings were 150 feet, with their twenty posts and their twenty bronze bases, with the hooks of the posts and their bands of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the west side there were hangings 75 feet long, with their ten posts and their ten bases, with the hooks of the posts and their bands of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the east side, toward the sunrise, it was 75 feet wide,
speaker: Narrator

text: with hangings on one side of the gate that were 22½ feet long, with their three posts and their three bases,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the second side of the gate of the courtyard, just like the other, the hangings were 22½ feet long, with their three posts and their three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the hangings around the courtyard were of fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bases for the posts were bronze. The hooks of the posts and their bands were silver, their tops were overlaid with silver, and all the posts of the courtyard had silver bands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The curtain for the gate of the courtyard was of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine twisted linen, the work of an embroiderer. It was 30 feet long and, like the hangings in the courtyard, it was 7½ feet high,
speaker: Narrator

text: with four posts and their four bronze bases. Their hooks and their bands were silver, and their tops were overlaid with silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the tent pegs of the tabernacle and of the courtyard all around were bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inventory of the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the testimony, which was counted by the order of Moses, being the work of the Levites under the direction of Ithamar, son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made everything that the Lord had commanded Moses;
speaker: Narrator

text: and with him was Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an artisan, a designer, and an embroiderer in blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the gold that was used for the work, in all the work of the sanctuary (namely, the gold of the wave offering) was 29 talents and 730 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The silver of those who were numbered of the community was 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel,
speaker: Narrator

text: one beka per person, that is, a half shekel, according to the sanctuary shekel, for everyone who crossed over to those numbered, from twenty years old or older, 603,550 in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The 100 talents of silver were used for casting the bases of the sanctuary and the bases of the special curtain—100 bases for 100 talents, one talent per base.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the remaining 1,775 shekels he made hooks for the posts, overlaid their tops, and made bands for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bronze of the wave offering was seventy talents and 2,400 shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: With it he made the bases for the door of the tent of meeting, the bronze altar, the bronze grating for it, and all the utensils of the altar,
speaker: Narrator

text: the bases for the courtyard all around, the bases for the gate of the courtyard, all the tent pegs of the tabernacle, and all the tent pegs of the courtyard all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the blue, purple, and scarlet yarn they made woven garments for serving in the sanctuary; they made holy garments that were for Aaron, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet yarn, and fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: They hammered the gold into thin sheets and cut it into narrow strips to weave them into the blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and into the fine linen, the work of an artistic designer.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made shoulder pieces for it, attached to two of its corners, so it could be joined together.
speaker: Narrator

text: The artistically woven waistband of the ephod that was on it was like it, of one piece with it, of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine twisted linen, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set the onyx stones in gold filigree settings, engraved as with the engravings of a seal with the names of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as stones of memorial for the Israelites, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the breastpiece, the work of an artistic designer, in the same fashion as the ephod, of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was square—they made the breastpiece doubled, nine inches long and nine inches wide when doubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set on it four rows of stones: a row with a ruby, a topaz, and a beryl—the first row;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the second row, a turquoise, a sapphire, and an emerald;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the fourth row, a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper. They were enclosed in gold filigree settings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The stones were for the names of the sons of Israel, twelve, corresponding to the number of their names. Each name corresponding to one of the twelve tribes was like the engravings of a seal.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made for the breastpiece braided chains like cords of pure gold,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they made two gold filigree settings and two gold rings, and they attached the two rings to the upper two ends of the breastpiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: They attached the two gold chains to the two rings at the ends of the breastpiece;
speaker: Narrator

text: the other two ends of the two chains they attached to the two settings, and they attached them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made two rings of gold and put them on the other two ends of the breastpiece on its edge, which is on the inner side of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made two more gold rings and attached them to the bottom of the two shoulder pieces on the front of the ephod, close to the juncture above the waistband of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: They tied the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod by blue cord, so that it was above the waistband of the ephod, so that the breastpiece would not be loose from the ephod, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the robe of the ephod completely blue, the work of a weaver.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was an opening in the center of the robe, like the opening of a collar, with an edge all around the opening so that it could not be torn.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made pomegranates of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and twisted linen around the hem of the robe.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made bells of pure gold and attached the bells between the pomegranates around the hem of the robe between the pomegranates.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the robe, to be used in ministering, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made tunics of fine linen—the work of a weaver, for Aaron and for his sons—
speaker: Narrator

text: and the turban of fine linen, the headbands of fine linen, and the undergarments of fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sash was of fine twisted linen and blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, the work of an embroiderer, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made a plate, the holy diadem, of pure gold and wrote on it an inscription, as on the engravings of a seal, “Holiness to the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They attached to it a blue cord to attach it to the turban above, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the work of the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, was completed, and the Israelites did according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses—they did it exactly so.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent and all its furnishings, clasps, frames, bars, posts, and bases;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the coverings of ram skins dyed red, the covering of fine leather, and the protecting curtain;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ark of the testimony and its poles, and the atonement lid;
speaker: Narrator

text: the table, all its utensils, and the Bread of the Presence;
speaker: Narrator

text: the pure lampstand, its lamps, with the lamps set in order, and all its accessories, and oil for the light;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the gold altar, and the anointing oil, and the fragrant incense; and the curtain for the entrance to the tent;
speaker: Narrator

text: the bronze altar and its bronze grating, its poles, and all its utensils; the large basin with its pedestal;
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the courtyard, its posts and its bases, and the curtain for the gateway of the courtyard, its ropes and its tent pegs, and all the furnishings for the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of meeting;
speaker: Narrator

text: the woven garments for serving in the sanctuary, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments for his sons to minister as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites did all the work according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses inspected all the work, and they had done it just as the Lord had commanded—they had done it exactly—and Moses blessed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the first day of the first month you are to set up the tabernacle, the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to place the ark of the testimony in it and shield the ark with the special curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to bring in the table and set out the things that belong on it; then you are to bring in the lampstand and set up its lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to put the gold altar for incense in front of the ark of the testimony and put the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to put the altar for the burnt offering in front of the entrance to the tabernacle, the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to put the large basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to set up the courtyard around it and put the curtain at the gate of the courtyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it, and sanctify it and all its furnishings, and it will be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you are to anoint the altar for the burnt offering with all its utensils; you are to sanctify the altar, and it will be the most holy altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must also anoint the large basin and its pedestal, and you are to sanctify it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are to bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you are to clothe Aaron with the holy garments and anoint him and sanctify him so that he may minister as my priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to bring his sons and clothe them with tunics
speaker: Narrator

text: and anoint them just as you anointed their father, so that they may minister as my priests; their anointing will make them a priesthood that will continue throughout their generations.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what Moses did, according to all the Lord had commanded him—so he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the tabernacle was set up on the first day of the first month, in the second year.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses set up the tabernacle and put its bases in place, he set up its frames, attached its bars, and set up its posts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he spread the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering of the tent over it, as the Lord had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took the testimony and put it in the ark, attached the poles to the ark, and then put the atonement lid on the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought the ark into the tabernacle, hung the protecting curtain, and shielded the ark of the testimony from view, just as the Lord had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses put the table in the tent of meeting, on the north side of the tabernacle, outside the curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set the bread in order on it before the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the lampstand in the tent of meeting opposite the table, on the south side of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he set up the lamps before the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the gold altar in the tent of meeting in front of the curtain,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he burned fragrant incense on it, just as the Lord had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses put the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also put the altar for the burnt offering by the entrance to the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, and offered on it the burnt offering and the meal offering, just as the Lord had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he put the large basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it for washing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron and his sons would wash their hands and their feet from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever they entered the tent of meeting, and whenever they approached the altar, they would wash, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set up the courtyard around the tabernacle and the altar, and put the curtain at the gate of the courtyard. So Moses finished the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was not able to enter the tent of meeting because the cloud settled on it and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the cloud was lifted up from the tabernacle, the Israelites would set out on all their journeys;
speaker: Narrator

text: but if the cloud was not lifted up, then they would not journey farther until the day it was lifted up.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cloud of the Lord was on the tabernacle by day, but fire would be on it at night, in plain view of all the house of Israel throughout all their journeys.
speaker: Narrator
